formattedAddress: 12 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 12 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
Awesome little venue, ideally located on a street with so much diversity, culture, and food!!! I can't believe I've lived in NYC for 15 years and hadn't even heard of it.

I was wandering around on a kinda wet, gloomy night and just wandered into this. There was a Snark Tank show happening and it ended up being one of the dark horse highlights of my year!!

The venue is quite small and there's no assigned seating so be sure to show up a little early to get in line to get seated. However, you can't be seated until the start time of a show because they do back to back shows, so don't show up too early. Probably 15 mins is the sweet spot.

They have a 2 drink minimum policy, similar to most comedy clubs in the city. And also serve chips and salsa, and sometimes empanadas. They do not have a full bar. You can only order what's on their limited menu.

originalText.text:
Lots of tasty vegan options. All from different parts of the world. I would come here wether I was plant based or not.

The prices compared to other spots in the city are decent. It was cool that we have the option to order at the counter or via tablet. We decided to go with the three for $10 empanada special. We got the Philly Cheese , Jamaican and the Bean Empanada. The crust of the empanadas were very flaky, which is a great touch.

The place was really clean and allowed patrons to use the restroom even during quarantine. Very cool owners! I would definitely come here again. But not order the bean empanada. It was very bland. The dipping sauce was good, more vinegar based and wasnâ€™t as thick as we preferred!

originalText.text: Came here onceâ€¦ never again. MINIMUM $40. They charge you for a ticket hours before a comedy show starts and you would think that would be the last mandatory payment you would make for the night - but no. You must buy AT LEAST 2 drinks that cost a higher amount that any other restaurant ive been and they have a worker that will rudely seek you out. Once spending more money on drinks than the ticket (I ordered a beer) they will come out approximately 30 minutes laterâ€¦. Warm. Safe to say I will not be back anytime soon.

originalText.text:
Let me start with the positive points. The venue is spacious with strategic location in the heart of St Mark's street. Awesome spot to include in your night out.
Friendly staff, nice ambient and
Part of the seating area was a theatric stairs where crowd can chill and enjoy the show.
Minimum two drinks order.
Concerning the show, I'm not sure what was wrong, there were few brilliant comedians but I felt the repertoire wasn't there and the audience were disconnected.
I understand that comic is hit or miss, and to me that night was a miss, unfortunately.
I trust the producer of the show are doing their best, and I wish them the best of luck

Cheers ðŸ¥‚

originalText.text:
I had a great time here at a show a few weeks ago. Would highly recommend!

A few things to mention
1. The hostess was really funny and opened the show with some crowd work to get the audience loosened up and ready for the rest of the comedians on stage.
2. They have a two drink minimum, which is standard for comedy clubs in New York and the rest of the country.
3. This was my second time coming to the club after coming a year ago. They made a lot of changes and greatly improved the overall experience for audience members. Definitely will be coming back when Iâ€™m back in town.
